text:
As discussed at the ApacheCon EU 2006 Lightning talks, the httpd should serve
propaganda by sending out the Apache Feather as favicon.ico file if not
configured otherwise.

The least intrusive way to do this seems to be a content handler:

LoadModule favicon_module     modules/mod_favicon.so
<Location /favicon.ico>
  SetHandler favicon
</Location>
creator: hps@intermeta.de

text:
I hope that is just a joke.

First: People out there may not use our trademark without written permission.

Second: Why? Why? Why another module? The easy way would be to put it into the
icons directory and alias it from there.

Third: More technical: Overspecified array sizes are just bad, like in
apache_favicon[APACHE_FAVICON_BYTES] = { all values }

So if this actually wasn't a joke: I didn't hear the lightning talk and cannot
imagine the reasoning. Such a decision has to be done on dev@ anyway, and I'm -1
on this module.

creator: hps@intermeta.de
text:
No, it is not a joke. 

You should have been there. The rap there was  "let's embed it as deeply in the
core as possible". :-)

About "overspecified arrays": What would you use? sizeof() ?
Proposals to turn httpd into a propaganda tool should definitely be made on dev@.
